title: Commission Regulation (EC) No 2125/96 of 5 November 1996 determining, for the 1996 marketing year, the estimated loss of income and the estimated level of the premium payable per ewe and per female goat and fixing the second advance payment for this premium
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EC) No 2125/96 of 5 November 1996 determining, for the 1996 marketing year, the estimated loss of income and the estimated level of the premium payable per ewe and per female goat and fixing the second advance payment for this premium
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: A difference is hereby estimated between the basic price, reduced by the impact of the coefficient laid down in Article 8 (2) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89, and the foreseeable market price during 1996 is ECU 113,785 per 100 kilograms.

1. The estimated amount of the premium payable per ewe is as follows:
- producers of heavy lambs: ECU 18,206
- producers of light lambs: ECU 14,565
2. Pursuant to Article 5 (6) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89, the second advance that the Member States are authorized to pay to producers shall be as follows:
- producers of heavy lambs: ECU 5,462 per ewe,
- producers of light lambs: ECU 4,370 per ewe.

1. The estimated amount of the premium payable per female of the caprine species in the areas designated in Annex I to Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89 and in Article 1 of Regulation (EEC) No 1065/86: ECU 14,565.
2. Pursuant to Article 5 (6) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89, the second advance which the Member States are authorized to pay to goatmeat producers located in the areas designated in paragraph 1 shall be as follows: ECU 4,370 per female of the caprine species.

Pursuant to Article 13 (3) of Regulation (EEC) No 1601/92, the second advance on the supplementary premium for the 1996 marketing year for producers of light lambs and she-goats in the Canary Islands within the limits provided for in Article 1 (1) of Regulation (EEC) No 3493/90 (10).
- ECU 1,092 per ewe in the case of producers referred to in Article 5 (3) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89,
- ECU 1,092 per she-goat in the case of the producers referred to in Article 5 (5) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
